Constructor Detail

Translate

public Translate()
Constructs class with default parameters.

Translate

public Translate(java.lang.String id,
                 java.lang.String type,
                 java.lang.String catg,
                 java.lang.String use,
                 java.lang.String ur)
Constructs class with specific settings

Parameters:
id - The application id used by the Microsoft Translator API
type - The format of the text being translated. The supported formats are "text/plain" and "text/html". Any HTML needs to be well-formed.
catg - The category of the text to translate. The only supported category is "general".
use - A string used to track the originator of submissions to the translator.
ur - Optional. A string containing the content location of submitted translations.

detectArray

public java.lang.String[] detectArray(java.lang.String[] texts)
                               throws TranslateFault
Identify the language of an array of string,Performs independent detection of each individual array element and returns a result for each row of the array

Parameters:
texts - array of strings that need to detect
Returns:
array of detected languages
Throws:
TranslateFault

getAppIdToken

public java.lang.String getAppIdToken(int minratingread,
                                      int maxratingwrite,
                                      int expireseconds)
                               throws TranslateFault
Returns a tokenized AppID which can be used as the AppID parameter in any method

Parameters:
minratingread - minimum rating translations require to be returned. Recommended is 5 as this will only include automatic translations and authority approved translations
maxratingwrite - maximum rating that a user can write with using this token. The recommended maxRatingWrite is from 1 to 4 for anonymous users, and from 6 to 10 for authoritative users whom you trust.
expireseconds - defines the duration in seconds from now that the token is valid. The value can be between 1 and 86400 (24 hours).
Returns:
AppID value
Throws:
TranslateFault

getLanguagesNames

public java.lang.String[] getLanguagesNames(java.lang.String locale,
                                            java.lang.String[] codeString)
                                     throws TranslateFault
Retrieves friendly names for the languages passed in languageCodes

Parameters:
locale - representing a combination of an ISO 639 two-letter lowercase culture code associated with a language and an ISO 3166 two-letter uppercase subculture code to localize the language names or a ISO 639 lowercase culture code by itself.
codeString - representing the ISO 639-1 language codes to retrieve the friendly name for.
Returns:
names for languages passed in languageCodes
Throws:
TranslateFault

                                          java.lang.String from,
                                          java.lang.String to,
                                          int maxtranslations)
                                   throws TranslateFault
Retrieves an array of translations for a given language pair from the store and the MT engine.

Parameters:
text - text to translate.
from - the language code of the source
to - the target language
maxtranslations - representing the maximum number of translations to return.
Returns:
array of translations
Throws:
TranslateFault

getTranslationsArray

public java.lang.String[] getTranslationsArray(java.lang.String[] texts,
                                               java.lang.String from,
                                               java.lang.String to,
                                               int maxtranslations)
                                        throws TranslateFault
Retrieve multiple translation candidates for multiple source texts.

Parameters:
texts - array containing the texts for translation. All strings should be of the same language.
from - the language code of the source
to - the target language
maxtranslations - representing the maximum number of translations to return.
Returns:
array of strings of translations for each text
Throws:
TranslateFault

speak

public java.lang.String speak(java.lang.String text,
                              java.lang.String language,
                              java.lang.String format)
                       throws TranslateFault
Returns a string which is a URL to a wave stream of the passed-in text being spoken in the desired language.

Parameters:
text - Containing a sentence or sentences of the specified language to be spoken for the wave stream.
language - representing the supported language code to speak the text in.
format - A string specifying the content-type ID. The default value is "audio/wav" which is the only currently allowed value.
Returns:
URL to wave stream of text spoken
Throws:
TranslateFault
